Hydras:

"Let you go????"said mockly the Predacon leader"N"


From: Sandy 
=
Sent: Friday, February 19, 2010 11:29 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subjec=
t: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Tucson would not be able to ge=
t out of his predicament. Not this time. He just accepts Hydra's word, and =
now realizes that this was not going to be the day he would recover Rodimus=
. It would have to wait. Something else had to be done first. There would b=
e no battle. He was easilly defeated.

" Perhaps you're right. Perhaps doin=
g what Perseus had done, was the right thing. And realizing that I am no ma=
tch for you. I give up. You are stronger than I am. And I will leave as you=
 request."

Giving up would be his only way out of his bind. That is if Hyd=
ras would let him go. Yet in giving up, he would regroup and think again of=
 how he would actually rescue his lost leader. 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.=
com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> HYdras:
> 
> "Stop the chit chat you impert=
inent and foolish Autobot" said Hydras while He spat agaisnts Tucson " You =
the autobots Speakt too much...." Hydras moved aroudn slowly and hissed "He=
 is in our side now, Perseus understood that, if he had the half of the cou=
rage that the firs autobots had he hadent negociated with us and leave Rodi=
mus at his fate... now is too late for him and for you"
> 
> With a Sudden =
movement Hydras trasforfed to hes beast mode, a 5 head hydra. he spread his=
 five heads towards Tuscon grabin with 2 of them Tucson's arms while two mo=
re attempred to grabe his legs
> 
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Friday, F=
ebruary 19, 2010 10:27 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Reco=
vering Rodimus/BlackFortress
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson had no idea what was happeni=
ng to him. Hydras reply comes as a shock to the Autobot, as he gives a blan=
k look all of a sudden. He could not answer his question without hesitation=
 in his voice.
> 
> " As - as far as I know, I - I... I - don't think I'm r=
elated to him. I deeply admire him, yes, but I honestly do not think I'm re=
lated to him."
> 
> His deeply hidden power of his spark recedes and quickl=
y returns him to his regular height. He had no notion of how to control it,=
 nor had he known what it was. As it reverses, he suddenly feels a good por=
tion of power leave his body, yet, he was not about to abandon the act of d=
efending himself against Hydras or Rodimus for that matter. 
> 
> " Power o=
r no power, you've abducted one of my own, and turned him into your evil pa=
wn. No matter the consequence, I will stand my ground and do whatever it ta=
kes to rightfully return my leader to his role as the commander of the Auto=
bots. Even if I have to saccrifice my own spark to accomplish my mission. T=
hat is why I'm here, not for power, not for lust, not for domination. I'm h=
ere because know it or not, someone who was once very close to me, needs my=
 help and I never turn my hand away when a fellow comrade is in grave dange=
r. I'm sure you would do the same for one of your own." 
> 
> He turns to R=
odimus. 
> 
> " If I do not succeed this time, I will suffer my defeat hono=
rably. I will fall many times if I have to. But rest assured Rodimus, when =
the time is right, and you finally reach out to me, I promise my hand will =
be there to reach out to you. And when I do, I won't let go. I promise, I w=
ill not abandon you or this cause. As dark as you are now, you may not unde=
rstand, but hopefully one day, you will." 
> 
> He then turns back to Hydra=
s.
> 
> " All right Hydras, I'll let you decide how you wish to fight. Afte=
r all, this is your domain, and I am an intruder here. " 
> 
> Deep down Tu=
cson wished he could avoid a scuffle. He wished he could just bargain with =
Hydras but after seeing that he was a combination of Megatron and Galvatron=
, that made for a different situation all together. To him, Decepticons wer=
e still his enemies. He was however still taken aback by Hydra's question. =
While he looks to Hydras he thinks to himself once more.
> 
> " Me? Related=
 to Optimus Prime?"
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:=

> >
> > Hydras:
> > Hydras stood up slowly in a non treaten way, and camly=
 walked a round the Scene watching the battle when Tucson looked like more =
like Optimus and he said "Yesss, this will be like the old good times... te=
ll me Scrappling, what's your relation with My old Pal, Optimus Prime?" sai=
d hydras with a remarcable ironic mocking tone in the word pal 
> > 
> > 
>=
 > 
> > 
> > From: Super Cyclonus 
> > Sent: Friday, February 19, 2010 11:2=
4 AM
> > To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> > Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/Bl=
ackFortress
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > The battle was not what it seemed . . . 
> >=
 
> > The punch Rodimus had thrown, the one that was so easily blocked by T=
uscon, would have shocked Rodimus had it landed. He would have been glad to=
 be rid of this annoyance, yes, but it would have been somewhat disappointi=
ng as well. 
> > 
> > So when Rodimus was spun around by Tuscon, the Autobo=
t may have missed the wicked smile on his face, When Tuscon tried to ram Ro=
dimus into a wall, he may not have noticed that the sound of crunching meta=
l was not Rodimus' but the reinrorced wall shearing and tearing under the f=
orce of the assault. It was not the sound of Rodimkus' defeat that resonate=
d through the room, but it was something else!
> > 
> > Many of the same te=
achers that had instructed Tuscon had trained a young Hot Rod as well - Jaz=
z, Prowl, Brawn, Kup, even Optimus himself! And while Rodimus no longer cle=
arly remembered all these ones and what they had meant to him, thier lesson=
s were still ground into him, and his reflexes that had been honed over the=
 years of battle! 
> > 
> > Also, this was no young Hot Rod that stood ther=
e before them, but a figure shapped by the energy of the matrix into a char=
acter of leadership, power and ability. He no longer had access to the know=
ledge and wisdom of the matrix, the energy having been stripped from him. B=
ut that power that had been imparted was still there, reconfigured by the p=
ower of the predacon shell program! He was faster, stronger and far more du=
rable then Hot Rod ever was, he was DARK RODIMUS!
> > 
> > So when Rodimus =
hit the wall it was not truely pain that he felt, but the elation that a tr=
ue battle was in the making. He felt that charge that all warriors felt whe=
n they faced a foe that had some metal! It was an eagerness twisted by Pred=
acon programming into something dark and loathsome. 
> > 
> > So when he st=
ood and turned around it was not defeat in his stance but derision, "So you=
 fancy yourself to be a Prime do you, scrappling?" Rodimus said his tone st=
ill mocking as he raised his arm, smiling as his optics glowing with energy=
, "Well let's see what you got!" With a thought he fired a blast of plasma =
energy from his arm mounted cannon at this new incarnation of Tuscon, who f=
or the moment appeared to be posturing for Hydras!
> > 
> > OOC: Remember, =
the matrix that is housed within Rodimus has no energy of its own, only the=
 housing. It does not have the power to reach out and transform anyone, alt=
hough I do have some ideas. I am not sure if you want to redo your post, or=
 let it go as it stands. 
> > 
> > Preston
> > (Cyclonus/Scourge/Dark rodim=
us)
> >
>
